Value.Value: Required Version
The version of 2sxc required for this app to work. Use it when you rely on 2sxc features which don't exist is other versions. read more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=app
Required DNN Version
The version of DNN required for this app to work. Use it when you rely on DNN features which don't exist is other versions. read more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=app
Supports Ajax Reload

If your views can handle being reloaded inside the page without requiring a page-refresh, then activate this. This setting applies to all views in this app, so only use it if your app is fully AJAX ready. Read more about this in 2sxc.org/help?tag=ajax
just a nice name which will be shown in dropdowns and similar
Name in URL Path

specify this if you want this template to be activated automatically, when some keywords appear in the url - like showing details when /post/395 is in the path (note: this only works in Apps) - read more
Hide from editor
hide this template from the normal selection - this is for templates you only want to insert once or twice, and then prevent additional uses

The template is a html or code file, which is will generate the output. It could be simple HTML showing a decorative line, a token-based HTML with placeholders like [Content:Title], or an advanced c# Razor template with placeholders like @Content.Title as well as conditions, loops etc.
C# Razor
this type determines which view-engine will be used to render the result
Token C# Razor
Portal File System
templates are usually stored in the portal - or in rare cases or in the shared, default-zone - note that sharing templates has various caveats, so you should read about shared templates here
Portal File System Host File System
Template file
choose or create the template file - more help
Content Specs
Templates show either Content, Data, both, or neither. If you're just getting started, Content is the way to go. Read more about this in the online help.
Content Type
the type of content this template will show - like a person, simple content, etc.
Content Demo Item
this item will be used for previews, so the user can see what the template does without entering any data
Presentation Options
Presentation settings are used to configure how your content will be shown. You can do very sophisticated things with this. Read more about it in help.
Content Type
the content-type which is used for presentation-settings
Demo item

this will contain a demo entity which is used as a default (when the editor doesn't provide custom presentation settings) as well as for preview - when the template is just showing the demo-item to the editor - more
List Settings

You can create templates which show multiple items - like a list of links or images. enable this here to tell the edit-UI, that this template can show more than just 1 item - so this will provide more buttons like add, move-up/down, etc. - more
Enable list
turn this on, to tell the UI that this template handles lists
Header Item ContentType
this is the content-type for the header-item (called the ListContent) in a list-template - more
Demo Item for the Header (ListContent)
the default / demo-item for the list header (ListContent) item - more
Content Type of the Header Presentation (ListContent.Presentation)
configure presentation settings of the list header - read more about lists or presentation settings
Demo Item for the Header Presentation
the default/demo item for list presentations - more about presentation settings
Data for this Template

A template instance can work with Content, Data, both or neither. Here you can configure the system to provide pre-processed data to the template. more

Important: queries can only be used in views of an App. They are not available for normal Content. more
Data Query
a prepared query which will provide data to this template - more
Advanced Settings
These settings are fairly advanced and you will usually not need them. Read more.
Enable Data-Publishing
enables instances of this view to provide the data it would render on the server as JSON - more about templates and more about publishing JSON data
Published Streams
if you choose to publish data, you must specify which streams you will publish for security reasons - more

AttributeSet.Name: 2SexyContent-Template-Asset
AttributeSet.Description: Documents assets used in a template.

Value.Value: Title of the asset - usually displayed in the how-it's done and in asset-lists.
Internal notes about this asset, purpose, description or special issues.
What kind of asset this is / type.
CSS File:css-file JavaScript File:js-file Image:img-file Additional Token Template:token Additional C# Template:razor-c# Additional VB Template:razor-vb Link:link
Relative Path

The path to a resource under the current portals file path. Relative because it can be in Portals/0/, in Portals/MySite/ etc.

Example: 2Sexy\Demo\MyFile.css

Wrong:
\2Sexy\Demo\MyFile.css (with leading slash)
Link to the asset (if not using the relative path, or if the asset is external).
Include Automatically
Automatically include this file (without a tag being issued from the template).
Don't include: Include In Line, before the template:inline-before Include In Line, after the template:inline-after Include using Client-Dependency:client-dependency
Include Priority
Used only if activating Client-Dependency Auto-Include, the order of including this.

AttributeSet.Name: 2SexyContent-Template-Metadata
AttributeSet.Description: Information about a template, mainly used in import/export

Value.Value: A visible name for the template. This is not an technical identifier. Please write something nice with spaces and everything so it's easy to read.
Your name or your company
Describe the template/tool, what it does etc.
Info Link
A link to further information, typically your web site containing a demo.

Apache License 2.0 (Apache):Apache New BSD License (BSD):BSD Common Development and Distribution License (CDDL):CDDL creative commons attribution 2.0:CC-BY-2.0 creative commons attribution 3.0:CC-BY-3.0 Eclipse Public License (EPL):EPL GNU General Public License version 2 (GPLv2):GPLv2 GNU Lesser General Public License (LGPL):LGPL The MIT License (MIT):MIT Mozilla Public License 2.0 (MPL-2.0):MPL-2.0 Microsoft Public License (Ms-PL):Ms-PL Microsoft Reciprocal License (Ms-RL):Ms-RL Non Open-Source (Copyrighted):Copyrighted Other:Other
Choose your license (we recommend MIT)
License Notes
Add additional licensing comments here (usually blank)
License Link
Set the link showing details for this licenses type
Installation Notes and Instructions
Put special instructions here, especially if you don't have a checklist (usually blank)
Installation Checklist ID
The SwissChecklist ID of the installation checklist (the 8-char code)

AttributeSet.Name: ContentGroupReference
AttributeSet.Description: A pointer / reference to a content group

Value.Value: This is the nice name shown in the end user dialogs. You should keep it short and simple. Read the recommendations in help.
A nice description of what this content-type is for. It will be shown as tool-tip or help-text in normal user dialogs, so keep it simple and non-techie.
Use this for internal, technical notes. It won't be shown to the content editors.
You can give this content-type an icon to use in tile-style buttons. Read the recommendations in help.
This is an optional link to further information, tutorials, help, etc. It will be shown to the end user if such a link exists.
Edit Instructions
Instructions shown to the user in the edit-form for additional help/assistance.

AttributeSet.Name: ContentType-InputType
AttributeSet.Description: Input type definition for a content-type

Value.Value: List the assets needed by your content type to create the input field. See help tag:custom-inputtype

AttributeSet.Name: DataPipeline
AttributeSet.Description: Describes a set of data sources and how they are interconnected.

Value.Value: Pipeline name
Descriptive Name
Short info about this pipeline, what it's for
Allow Edit
If set to false, the pipeline-system will only show this pipeline but not allow changes.
Streams Out
Comma separated list of streams this pipeline offers to the target. Like 'Content, Presentation, ListContent, ListPresentation'
Stream Wiring
List of connections between the parts of this pipeline, each connection on one line, like 6730:Default>6732:Default
Static Parameters to test the Pipeline with. Format as [Token:Property]=Value

AttributeSet.Name: DataPipelinePart
AttributeSet.Description: A part in the data pipeline, usually a data source/target element.

Value.Value: The part name for easy identification by the user
Notes about this item
Part Assembly and Type
Assembly and type info to help the system find this dll etc.
Visual Designer Data
Technical data for the designer so it can save it's values etc.
Security Rule
A title just to help you know what this rule is for.

Why this security rule should apply.
Learn more on 2sxc.org/help?tag=permissions

Please Select: SecurityAccessLevel.Anonymous SecurityAccessLevel.View SecurityAccessLevel.Edit SecurityAccessLevel.Admin SecurityAccessLevel.Host SecurityAccessLevel.ControlPanel SecurityAccessLevel.SkinObject SecurityAccessLevel.ViewPermissions Author / Creator of a Content-Item:Owner

What we will grant in this rule. 
Learn more on 2sxc.org/help?tag=permissions

None (no permissions defined):- Read:r Create (no read or edit):c Update (read and modify existing):ru Delete:d Edit (Create, Read, Update, Delete):crud All Content (CRUD + Approve):cruda Design/Develop (modify internal structure):crudav Design and Permissions:crudavp Full Control (usually host only):crudavpz
